title: How to Connect to a Network Printer

steps.title: Turn on your printer.
steps.content: Turn on your printer. Plug your printer into an electrical outlet if necessary, then press the printer's "Power" button to turn on the printer if it isn't already on.

steps.title: Make sure your printer is connected to Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Make sure your printer is connected to Wi-Fi. In order to connect to your printer via a network, your printer must be connected to Wi-Fi. The steps for connecting a printer to Wi-Fi will vary from printer to printer, so check your printer's manual or online documentation for model-specific instructions on connecting to Wi-Fi. Some printers must be connected directly to your router via an Ethernet cable in order to connect to the Internet.

steps.title: Connect your computer to your printer's Wi-Fi network if necessary.
steps.content: Connect your computer to your printer's Wi-Fi network if necessary. Most printers require you to be connected to the same network to which your printer is connected. If your computer is connected to a different network, do the following: Click the "Wi-Fi" icon on the right side of the taskbar. Click the name of the Wi-Fi network to which your printer is connected. Click Connect . Enter the password and click Next if asked for a password.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Open Settings .
steps.content: Open Settings . Click the gear-shaped icon in the lower-left side of the Start window.

steps.title: Click Devices.
steps.content: Click Devices . It's in the middle of the Settings window.

steps.title: Click Printers & scanners.
steps.content: Click Printers & scanners . This tab is on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Click Add a printer or scanner.
steps.content: Click Add a printer or scanner . It's at the top of the window. Doing so opens a list of available printers on your network.

steps.title: Select your printer's name.
steps.content: Select your printer's name. Click the name of the printer to which you want to connect. The printer's name will expand. Your printer's name is usually a combination of the printer's manufacturer's name and the model number.

steps.title: Click Add device.
steps.content: Click Add device . It's below the expanded printers name. Your computer will begin connecting to the printer.

steps.title: Follow any on-screen prompts.
steps.content: Follow any on-screen prompts. Depending on your printer, it may need to install drivers or be verified by your computer. If so, click through any on-screen prompts as they appear.

steps.title: Turn on your printer.
steps.content: Turn on your printer. Plug your printer into an electrical outlet if necessary, then press the printer's "Power" button to turn on the printer if it isn't already on.

steps.title: Make sure your printer is connected to Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Make sure your printer is connected to Wi-Fi. In order to connect to your printer via a network, your printer must be connected to Wi-Fi. The steps for connecting a printer to Wi-Fi will vary from printer to printer, so check your printer's manual or online documentation for model-specific instructions on connecting to Wi-Fi. Some printers must be connected directly to your router via an Ethernet cable in order to connect to the Internet.

steps.title: Connect your computer to your printer's Wi-Fi network if necessary.
steps.content: Connect your computer to your printer's Wi-Fi network if necessary. Most printers require you to be connected to the same network to which your printer is connected. If your computer is connected to a different network, do the following: Click the "Wi-Fi" icon in the top-right corner of the screen. Click the name of the Wi-Fi network to which your printer is connected. Enter the password if prompted. Click Join .

steps.title: Open the Apple menu .
steps.content: Open the Apple menu . Click the Apple logo in the top-left corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click System Preferences….
steps.content: Click System Preferences… . It's in the drop-down menu. The System Preferences window will open.

steps.title: Click Printers & Scanners.
steps.content: Click Printers & Scanners . This is on the right side of the System Preferences window.

steps.title: Click ＋.
steps.content: Click ＋ . It's below the left-hand sidebar. Doing so brings up a list of available printers.

steps.title: Select your printer's name.
steps.content: Select your printer's name. Click the name of the printer to which you want to connect. Your printer's name is usually a combination of the printer's manufacturer's name and the model number.

steps.title: Click Add.
steps.content: Click Add . It's at the bottom of the list. Your Mac will begin connecting to the printer.

steps.title: Follow any on-screen prompts.
steps.content: Follow any on-screen prompts. Depending on your printer, it may need to install drivers or be verified by your computer. If so, click through any on-screen prompts as they appear.
